definition: to dip into one's pocket/to pay out of pocket/to foot the bill
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: An administration official said the Obamas would foot the bill for the celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 一个政府官员说，奥巴马要为聚会活动自掏腰包。

sentences.english: A: I have a tuition scholarship from the university. Otherwise I’m on my own.
sentences.chinese: 学校只让我免缴学费，其余还是自掏腰包。

sentences.english: She has been compelled to dub up out of her own pocket.
sentences.chinese: 她被迫自己掏腰包付了账。

sentences.english: Misers put their back and their belly into their pockets.
sentences.chinese: 守财奴宁可打赤膊饿肚皮，也舍不得掏腰包。

sentences.english: Better yet, a lot of customers pay out of pocket.
sentences.chinese: 更有利的是许多客户都是自掏腰包支付费用。

sentences.english: I have a tuition scholarship from the university. Otherwise I'm on my own.
sentences.chinese: 学校只让我免缴学费，其余还是自掏腰包。

sentences.english: In fact, if you could you would pay to be on Oprah.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，如果你可以，你会自掏腰包上奥普拉的节目。

sentences.english: Do you think that men should always pick up the tab on a blind date?
sentences.chinese: 你认为男女经人介绍初次约会时都要由男的掏腰包吗？

sentences.english: Clearly, this is an industry hoping to get people reaching for their wallets again.
sentences.chinese: 显然，消费电子业的目标是吸引人们再掏腰包。

sentences.english: Still, some gamers say they plan to open their wallets for both.
sentences.chinese: 不过，有一些玩家说他们计划掏腰包买下两个游戏。

sentences.english: Even cautious German householders are opening their wallets.
sentences.chinese: 连谨慎的德国家庭也在掏腰包消费。

sentences.english: If their loan books go bad, the shareholders will have to stump up.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们的借贷账册变坏，股东就要为此自掏腰包。

sentences.english: Do the heirs have to pay this out of pocket?
sentences.chinese: 那么继承人需要自己掏腰包支付吗？

definition: to pay the bill (in a restaurant etc) (loanword from Cantonese)/(fig.) to bear responsibility
lit. to loosen one's purse/fig. to give generously to help others
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to lose money instead of being paid (i.e. sb should pay me, but is actually taking my money)
lit. stake a thousand pieces of gold on one throw (idiom); to throw away money recklessly/extravagant
